title: English Language Familiarization Quiz - Medium Difficulty
description: Enhance your English skills with this quiz focusing on sentence construction, vocabulary, and common expressions.
instructions: Write your answer in English, focusing on correct usage and grammar.
After completing all questions, submit your answers for evaluation.

items.question: Rewrite the following using a conditional sentence: 'He didn't study, so he failed the test.'
items.suggestedAnswer: If he had studied, he would not have failed the test.

items.question: What does the idiom 'to burn the midnight oil' mean?
items.suggestedAnswer: To work late into the night or very early morning.

items.question: Fill in the blank with the correct verb form: 'She would have been successful if she ___ (pursue) her goals more aggressively.'
Explain the meaning of the phrasal verb 'to back down'.
items.suggestedAnswer: To withdraw or yield in a confrontation or competition.

items.question: Choose the correct word: 'His ___ (persuasive/perspicuous) argument convinced everyone in the meeting.'
Rewrite in reported speech: 'They said, "We are moving to a new city next month."'
items.suggestedAnswer: They said that they were moving to a new city the following month.

items.question: Complete the sentence with an appropriate modal verb: 'You ___ (can/might/must) be more careful when handling chemicals.'
Define the word 'aberration'.
items.suggestedAnswer: A departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically an unwelcome one.

items.question: Convert the following to the future perfect tense: 'She finishes the project.'
items.suggestedAnswer: She will have finished the project.
